references.paper_title: FaceForensics++: Learning to detect manipulated facial images
references.reason: This paper is the most important because it introduced a large-scale dataset (FaceForensics++) that has become a benchmark for deepfake detection research, significantly impacting the field.

references.paper_title: Exposing deepfake videos by detecting face warping artifacts
references.reason: This is among the most important references due to its early contribution in exploring face warping artifacts as a clue for deepfake detection, influencing subsequent research directions.

references.paper_title: Face X-ray for more general face forgery detection
references.reason: This paper is important for proposing the 'Face X-ray' method, which uses image blending to create training data and improve the generalization ability of deepfake detectors.
This paper is considered important for proposing a new data augmentation method using self-blended images that improves deepfake detector performance.

references.paper_title: UCF: Uncovering common features for generalizable deepfake detection
references.reason: This is an important reference as it proposes a novel method (UCF) that focuses on discovering common features across different deepfake methods to improve generalization, a crucial aspect in deepfake detection.
